posts.post_content:
Erik's Random card 6/23/2011  
  
I was playing when Arabian Nights was released. I liked Control Magic, but it was a bit too good (and annoying) so people complained, and I switched to Royal Assassin and Prodigal Sorcerer (Tim). I loved Old Man because it still took stuff, but wasn't quite as good at it, and was easier to deal with. People didn't complain :)  
  
When I was designing Masters Edition III, initially I had In the Eye of Chaos instead of Old Man of the Sea. ME 3 is primarily composed of cards from Legends, The Dark, and Portal Three Kingdoms. In the Eye of Chaos is in Legends. Old Man is in Arabian Nights, so by set it would be in Master's Edition IV.  
  
I decided to sketch out ME 4, and see what it looked like. I noticed both Control Magic and Old Man of the Sea were in that set. They are very powerful limited cards with very similar effects, and I thought it would be more fun to only have one in each set. I picked Old Man to go in ME 3; ME4 was going to have Beta, and t... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

I decided to sketch out ME 4, and see what it looked like. I noticed both Control Magic and Old Man of the Sea were in that set. posts.post_content: @A3Kitsune: there used to be a nymph in Magic: [Shanodin Dryads](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shanodin Dryads). Unfortunately, since dryads are now a type and pretty much else is going to be an elemental, I don't think there'll ever be any more nymphs.
posts.html:
